messages.content: Earlier this year, I left the Conservative Party because it had shifted beyond recognition. It is now in the grip of its right-wing and has no room for moderate views. It has also abandoned any serious commitment to tackling burning injustices. I just couldn’t stay with the Conservative Party. Its relentless determination to push ahead with Brexit, no matter what the cost, has divided the country and put so much at risk. Urgent problems - like climate change, widening inequality, the lack of affordable housing and our overstretched NHS – have been neglected. The prospect of No Deal Brexit has already put our economy in reverse, making it even harder for so many in our country. And ultimately, Boris Johnson only cares about himself, not the future of the UK. That’s why earlier this year, like 26,000 others in the last 6 months, I joined the Liberal Democrats. Under Jo Swinson, a Liberal Democrat government will create a shared vision for the country we want to be, where every single person and community is valued, empowered and cared for, and where we protect our planet for future generations. The Liberal Democrats will reinvent the relationship between business and the communities in which they operate, so that they are a part of the solution to our biggest challenges, not the problem. The local and European elections showed that people are ready to get behind the most consistent, credible, leading Remain party force in British politics – the Liberal Democrats. At the General Election this December, I urge you to vote Liberal Democrat.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes No Deal Brexit, supports remaining in the EU.
Focus on climate change and protecting the planet for future generations.
Criticizes economic reversal due to Brexit, promotes Liberal Democrat economic policies.
Addresses the neglect of the NHS.

examples: That’s why earlier this year, like 26,000 others in the last 6 months, I joined the Liberal Democrats.
Earlier this year, I left the Conservative Party because it had shifted beyond recognition.
It is now in the grip of its right-wing and has no room for moderate views.
It has also abandoned any serious commitment to tackling burning injustices.
I just couldn’t stay with the Conservative Party.
Its relentless determination to push ahead with Brexit, no matter what the cost, has divided the country and put so much at risk.
Urgent problems - like climate change, widening inequality, the lack of affordable housing and our overstretched NHS – have been neglected.
The prospect of No Deal Brexit has already put our economy in reverse, making it even harder for so many in our country.
And ultimately, Boris Johnson only cares about himself, not the future of the UK.

Under Jo Swinson, a Liberal Democrat government will create a shared vision for the country we want to be, where every single person and community is valued, empowered and cared for, and where we protect our planet for future generations.
The Liberal Democrats will reinvent the relationship between business and the communities in which they operate, so that they are a part of the solution to our biggest challenges, not the problem.
The local and European elections showed that people are ready to get behind the most consistent, credible, leading Remain party force in British politics – the Liberal Democrats.
At the General Election this December, I urge you to vote Liberal Democrat.
Kind regards,
Sarah Wollaston
PS. If Remainers come together, we can combat the hatred and division at the extremes of the Conservative and Labour parties. We can build a brighter future.

Published and promoted by M. Dixon on behalf of the Liberal Democrats, 8-10 Great George Street, London, SW1P 3AE. Printed by St. Austell Printing Company Ltd, St. Austell Business Park, St. Austell, Cornwal, PL25 4FD.
